org.catechis.admin
Class FileUserUtilities

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.admin.FileUserUtilities
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserUtilities
public class FileUserUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserUtilities

This class gets a list of users, their folders/categories adds/gets login entries and sets up a list of options in the createUserOptions method to be passed to JDOMFiles which will create a new users option file.

addNewUser

public boolean addNewUser(java.lang.String user_name,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          java.lang.String e_mail)
This method has to do quite a lot. As this project has grown,

the architecture has grown in a not so organized or consistant way.

Here are the basic steps:

check to see if user already exists

add entry in user passes

create user folder inside /web_inf/files/ folder

create vocab subfolder

create the vocab/history folder to hold year-month-week.xml weekly session history reports

create status.record file in vocab folder

create user_name.hist file

create daily test.record files

create user_name.options file

create level <#> .test files

Returns false if the user name already exists.

Specified by:
addNewUser in interface UserUtilities

addNewTeacher

public boolean addNewTeacher(java.lang.String teacher_name,
                             java.lang.String password,
                             java.lang.String e_mail)

Create a new password entry for the user in user.pases.

create teacher folder.

Create a file to class/group lists in their folder. Returns false if the user name/id already exists. The directory structor for a teacher is as follows: files/admin/teachers.xml files/admin/teachers/teacher_id/teacher_id.options files/admin/teachers/teacher_id/classes.xml files/admin/teachers/teacher_id/lists.xml files/admin/teachers/teacher_id/classes/class_id.xml files/admin/teachers/teacher_id/lists/list_id.xml

getTeachers

public java.util.Vector getTeachers()
This method returns a list of teacher ids from the files/admin/teachers.xml file/ The caller must send the full path to the file in the constructor.

getClasses

public java.util.Hashtable getClasses(java.lang.String teacher_id)
In the teacher_id's folder is a file classes.xml with the folloring format: 0000000000000000001 jukseong5 The class_id element represents a file inside the classes folder which is just a list of student id's for students in each class. This method will rturn the class_id-class_name pairs as a Hashtable.

getStudents

public java.util.Hashtable getStudents(java.lang.String teacher_id,
                                       java.lang.String class_id)
Return a hash of student ids/student names from the file /home/timmy/Desktop/tomcat WEB-INF/files/admin/teachers//classes/.xml file which has the format:

-7028961644117975960 ...

This method gets a Hash of user_id-user_name pairs from the user.passes files, and uses these to get the user_names for the list of ids in the class_id.xml file.

createTestFile

private void createTestFile(java.lang.String user_folder_path,
                            int i,
                            java.lang.String type)
The options in the individual test files are as such: description=Not even really necessary, as all text should be in the bundles... type=reading length=10 * this is the number of words tested, ten or less by default. levels=0-0 * test words between this test range index=10 * I have no idea what this is for. I did make this file format three years ago, so dont u judge ME! shuffle=yes * This definately is not used, I tried, but you know how it goes...

createUserOptions

private void createUserOptions(java.lang.String user_folder_path,
                               java.lang.String user_name)
The user.options file in each users folder has the following properties held in name=value pairs:

native_languge=English

language_being_learned=Korean

encoding=euc-kr

locale=ko_KR

grade_whitespace=false

max_level=3

exclude_chars=,

exclude_area=true

exclude_area_begin_char=[

exclude_area_end_char=]

alternate_answer_separator=/

exclude_level0_test=1

exclude_level1_test=15

exclude_level2_test=60

exclude_level3_test=100

daily_words_limit=100

record_passed_tests=false

record_failed_tests=true

record_limit=25

record_exclude_level=0

weekly_list_remove_repeats=false

format_tr_width=140 This is the table row width for a single page format

format_table_width=340 This option is the width of an individual table in a single page format.

format_table_limit=14 This is the number of words to include in each table, less the number of wrapped lines.

format_tr_pixels=75 This is used in the FormatPanel to judge the number of pixels before a string wraps happens in a bable row

These options turn on or off the lists that will be printed for instance in the weekly_list_format.jsp page.

format_print_reading=true

format_print_writing=false

format_print_missed_reading=true

format_print_missed_witing=false

createNewWordsListFiles

public void createNewWordsListFiles(java.lang.String lists_folder_path)
The tags kept in this file are created in FileJDOMWordLists.addToRetiredWordsList like this:

602368600589700127

old words.xml This is the words file category, not really a path...

¿ÀÂ¡¾î

squid

Right now if a user edits a text or a definition, every word in the lists folder, should also be updated.

The thing is, these files came from the idea of recording tests, and then only recording missed word test greater than level 0.

Then the comceptual dilemma comes, if a user edits the text or definition contents, should test histories be updated?

I know what your saying, there should be no text or def tags in these files, only id that would link to the master word file.

The problem with this is that right now, late 2008, to make a list of words to study like WeeklyWordListAction does,

about 200 to 400 files would have to be opened to make the list, which is just too darn much.

So hire me a dba to setup MySql and Hibernate for me. I have programming to do!

The tags kept in this file are the same asin a new words -type-.list file and are created in FileJDOMWordLists.addToRetiredWordsList

createJSPWeeklyListFormatOptions

private void createJSPWeeklyListFormatOptions(java.lang.String jsp_options_folder_path)
The optins folder has the following properties held in name=value pairs:

format_tr_width=140 This is the table row width for a single page format

format_table_width=340 This option is the width of an individual table in a single page format.

format_table_limit=14 This is the number of words to include in each table, less the number of wrapped lines.

format_tr_pixels=75 This is used in the FormatPanel to judge the number of pixels before a string wraps happens in a bable row

These options turn on or off the lists that will be printed for instance in the weekly_list_format.jsp page.

format_print_reading=true

format_print_writing=false

format_print_missed_reading=true

format_print_missed_witing=false

createSavedTestsFile

public void createSavedTestsFile(java.lang.String tests_folder_path)
The saved subj/tests/saved tests.xml is just an id and name value pairs. The class org.catechis.dto.SavedTest is a bean that carries an instance of a saved_test element. The test_format depends on the action creating it, such as DailyTest, IntegratedTest, SpecificTest. The files inside can have a format like this: The files will be named after the id.

The method is public so that we can retroactively add this file to old users if necessary.
